intro: Elaphoglossum subnudum, commonly known as the slender fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically green with a slightly glossy surface. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves, which are clustered in sori covered by a protective indusium. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forests. Elaphoglossum subnudum is a low-growing plant that plays a role in forest floor ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling.
